bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 107 (Tuesday, June 25, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. NAPOLITANO:H.R. 3465.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, section 8, clause 18 of the United StatesConstitution[Page H5167]

item.fullName: Rep. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

item.title: H.R. 3465, Fallen Journalists Memorial Act of 2019

item.text:
Fallen Journalists Memorial Act of 2019

This bill authorizes the Fallen Journalists Memorial Foundation to establish a commemorative work on federal land in commemoration of the sacrifices made by journalists for a free and independent press.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.text:
Fallen Journalists Memorial Act

This bill authorizes the Fallen Journalists Memorial Foundation to establish a commemorative work on federal land in commemoration of America's commitment to a free press as represented by journalists who sacrificed their lives in their line of work.
item.name: Reported to House

item.text:
Fallen Journalists Memorial Act

This bill authorizes the Fallen Journalists Memorial Foundation to establish a commemorative work on federal land in commemoration of America's commitment to a free press as represented by journalists who sacrificed their lives in service to that cause.

Federal funds may not be used to pay any expense for the establishment of the commemorative work.

The bill makes the Fallen Journalists Memorial Foundation solely responsible for acceptance of contributions and payment of the expenses for the establishment of the commemorative work.
item.name: Passed House

item.text:
Fallen Journalists Memorial Act

This bill authorizes the Fallen Journalists Memorial Foundation to establish a commemorative work on federal land in commemoration of America's commitment to a free press as represented by journalists who sacrificed their lives in service to that cause.

Federal funds may not be used to pay any expense for the establishment of the commemorative work.

The bill makes the Fallen Journalists Memorial Foundation solely responsible for acceptance of contributions and payment of the expenses for the establishment of the commemorative work.
item.name: Passed Senate

bill.title: Fallen Journalists Memorial Act

item.titleType: Short Title(s) as Reported to House
item.title: Fallen Journalists Memorial Act
To authorize the Fallen Journalists Memorial Foundation to establish a commemorative work in the District of Columbia and its environs, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
